snippet: Though there are far fewer accidents at grade crossings in New York City than in its suburbs, the five boroughs have their own dark history with the intersections.
abstract: Growing awareness of accidents at railroad grade crossings may seem to have little resonance in New York City, but metropolis has its own dark history of deadly incidents at intersections; high rate of deaths in the early 20th century compelled city to eliminate some 105 crossings of the New York Central Railroad, culminating in the construction of the High Line.
lead_paragraph: Though there are far fewer accidents at grade crossings in New York City than in its suburbs, the five boroughs have their own dark history with the intersections.

headline.print_headline: City Rail Crossings Carry a Deadly Past
headline.main: New York City Rail Crossings Carry a Deadly Past
